title: Write more blog articles, not fewer (Don't leave the scraps on the cutting floor)
description: The perfect blog article takes the reader on a journey that some would say looks like this: Starting from the position of a problem statement, the reader is taken on an exposition of the solution, through to joyful crescendo of benefits and a climactic finale of world peace a solid explanation of why the tool or product is the right tool for the reader to use. Right on. Meanwhile, back in the real world, we all know that the development process never looks like that beautifully clean and unadorned linear path. Rather, it looks more like this: We set off an idea with a full knapsack of sustenance and resources, confident of the direction of our journey. Shortly after, we realise that didn’t read the map quite close enough. Progress stalls as we take time to familiarise ourselves with new concepts or more detailed understanding of existing ones. After a while we’re back on course, and things are going great. Progress continues at a linear rate, until it doesn’t. We hit a nasty bug, an...

title: 5 Costly Mistakes Businesses Do When Hiring App Developers
description: In today's digital world, having a mobile app is essential for business success. Whether you're looking for Android app development or iOS app development services , choosing the right development partner can make or break your project. Unfortunately, many business owners make common mistakes that lead to wasted time, budget overruns, and disappointing results. To help you avoid these pitfalls, here are five common mistakes businesses make when hiring a mobile app development company—and how to choose the right one for your needs. 1. Choosing the Cheapest Option Over Quality Many businesses fall into the trap of selecting the cheapest mobile app development company they can find. While cost is an important factor, making it the primary decision-making criterion often leads to disastrous outcomes. Cheap services may come with hidden costs, poor quality, and lack of post-development support. How to Avoid This Mistake: Instead of focusing only on cost, assess the company’s experience, ...

title: The Template for Hosting a Successful Tech Meetup
description: At Shipyard, we’ve found engaging with our developer communities in-person has been one of the best ways to stay in the loop. We’ve learned about cool technologies, found out what people are building, and met dozens (hundreds?) of interesting people in our space. If you’re on the fence about hosting a meetup, just do it. Chances are, your community is out there and looking for others with similar interests. Here’s our general strategy for designing/hosting a tech event, and the lessons we’ve learned along the way. Tip #1: Find the gap in your community Browse Meetup.com. Does your developer community exist? Has it been dormant since pre-pandemic? Find a broad focus to center your community around, something that at least a couple thousand locals can relate to, e.g. DevOps, devtools, product management, tech sales, Golang, webapps, Docker, Terraform, etc. From here, you can start collecting names and emails of your friends, colleagues, and acquaintances who are part of this community...

title: Qualcomm acquires AI platform Edge Impulse to boost Dragonwing chips
description: Edge Impulse, a TNW community member that produces an AI platform for developers, has been acquired by American chip giant Qualcomm for an undisclosed sum. Qualcomm said it had bought Edge Impulse to boost its machine learning software capabilities, particularly for its Dragonwing line of AI-powered chips. Nakul Duggal, Qualcomm’s head of IoT, said the acquisition would strengthen his firm’s “leadership in AI” and bolster “critical sectors such as retail, security, energy and utilities, supply chain management, and asset management.” Under the deal, Edge Impulse will integrate its operations with Qualcomm’s, but maintain its own offices, employees, and website. “Our team… This story continues at The Next Web

title: AI’s Role in the Developer Ecosystem: The Future of Knowledge Management
description: In today’s fast-paced tech landscape, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is reshaping how developers access and manage information. Traditional documentation, once the backbone of software development, is evolving into intelligent knowledge management systems that offer real-time updates, smart search, and personalized content delivery. AI-powered platforms like Doc-E.ai are driving this shift, making documentation more dynamic and efficient. The Evolution from Documentation to AI-Powered Knowledge Systems For years, developers have relied on static documentation to troubleshoot issues and learn about new technologies. However, as codebases expand and technologies evolve, maintaining up-to-date documentation becomes increasingly difficult. AI-driven knowledge management systems address this challenge by introducing: ✅ Smart Search Capabilities – AI-powered search helps developers instantly find relevant information. ✅ Personalized Content Recommendations – AI delivers insights tailored to...

title: Revolutionizing Developer Support: How AI Automates Assistance & Boosts Engagement
description: In the world of software development , timely and accurate support is crucial. Developers often face complex technical challenges that require quick resolutions to keep projects on track. However, providing consistent and efficient support can be a daunting task, especially for growing communities. Enter Doc-E.ai , an AI-powered tool designed to automate developer support, reduce response times, and improve overall satisfaction. By leveraging advanced natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning , Doc-E.ai transforms the way technical support is delivered, ensuring that developers get the help they need, when they need it. In this blog, we’ll explore how Doc-E.ai automates developer support, the benefits it brings to your community, and how you can implement it to enhance your support processes. The Challenges of Traditional Developer Support Traditional support methods often struggle with various challenges, such as: 1. High Query Volume: Developer communities generate nu...

title: Starting My DevRel Journey with DxMentorship: How Technical Writing Led Me Here
description: Our First Session (Kickoff Session) For the past year, I've been looking to do Developer Relations(DevRel) stuffs. I've done a lot of research and realized it's a field where you (might) have to wear multiple hats. It feels good, ngl :) After all the fun research stuff and looking for ways to break into DevRel or at least start doing DevRel stuff, I realized I was already doing one (Technical Writing) Technical Writing was the easiest way in for me because of my technical experience. And writing this now, I see why Ekene said during the kickoff session, "Eventually, you'll navigate towards the path of LEAST RESISTANCE" to answer a mentees question of "How do we know the path we would take?" . This made a whole lot of sense to me. As I've joined this program, I'm open to exploring and I hope to find other areas of DevRel I will resonate with (pretty cool, tbh) The Kickoff Session Ekene Eze welcomed us as we joined the call. He talked about the programs duration, our weekly sessions, ...

title: What is DevRel? or at least what is to me
description: I was recently accepted into the 4th cohort of DxMentorship program to kickstart my DevRel career. This blog post is one of the tasks from the program - to share my understanding of what DevRel (Developer Relations) is. As I begin this journey, I wanted to share my thoughts on this position that bridges technology and community. Having excellent technology isn't enough. Based on what I've seen, successful products need both technical excellence and human connection. This is exactly why Developer Relations (DevRel) plays such an important role. What is DevRel and What Do They Actually Do? At its core, Developer Relations is about building relationships between a company and the developers who use (or might use) its products. But what does this look like in practice? DevRel position typically: Create educational content (tutorials, blog posts, sample projects) Speak at conferences and meetups Build and nurture developer communities Collect and relay developer feedback to product teams...

title: How AI is Transforming Developer Relations and Community Management
description: In today’s fast-moving tech landscape, developer relations (DevRel) and community management play a crucial role in a company’s success. However, as developer communities expand, so do the challenges—keeping up with feedback, engaging meaningfully, and understanding developer needs can become overwhelming. This is where Artificial Intelligence (AI) steps in. AI is revolutionizing how tech companies connect with their developer communities, providing valuable insights and making DevRel teams more efficient. Let’s explore how AI is reshaping developer relations and community management. 1. Understanding Developer Sentiment at Scale Manually tracking developer conversations across platforms like GitHub , Slack , and Discord can be exhausting and inefficient. AI-powered sentiment analysis can scan discussions, categorize feedback, and identify common pain points , offering real-time insights into developer concerns. Example: AI tools like Doc-E.ai can analyze thousands of interactions t...

title: AI vs. Traditional Methods: Which Is Better for DevRel Strategy?
description: Developer Relations (DevRel) is evolving rapidly, with AI-driven solutions like Doc-E.ai revolutionizing traditional engagement strategies. But how does AI compare to traditional DevRel methods? This blog explores the advantages and limitations of both approaches and how AI-powered insights can supercharge your DevRel strategy. Traditional DevRel Methods Developer Relations (DevRel) has always been about building meaningful relationships between developers and companies. Traditional DevRel methods focus on human interactions, including: Community Engagement – Engaging in forums, Slack , Discord , and social media discussions. Meetups & Conferences – Hosting and attending events to connect with developers. Content Creation – Writing blogs, creating documentation, and producing videos to educate and engage. Developer Support – Addressing developer issues via support tickets and forums. Advocacy Programs – Collaborating with developer advocates and influencers. Strengths and Challenges...
